meanings.definition: To convert or be converted into glass or a glassy substance, especially through heat.
meanings.sent1: The intense heat caused the sand to vitrify and turn into glass.
meanings.sent2: The artist used a kiln to vitrify the clay sculpture into a shiny glass artwork.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy chef accidentally vitrified the sugar, turning it into a solid glassy mess.
meanings.sent4: Her heart seemed to vitrify, becoming cold and unyielding after the betrayal.
meanings.sent5: The magic spell seemed to vitrify the water, transforming it into a crystal-clear orb.
